intro: Desmoncus latisectus, commonly known as the broad-leafed desmoncus, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of the northern hemisphere. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring a fibrous root system and a robust, branching stem. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pale pink, blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are broad and lance-shaped, with a slightly hairy surface, and are arranged alternately along the stem. Desmoncus latisectus is often found in moist, well-drained soils in woodland edges and meadows.
